9: Water covers about 71% of the Earth's surface, with oceans making up about 96.5% of the Earth's water.
(1) Oceans make up the majority of the Earth's water, covering 71% of the Earth's surface.
(2) About 71% of Earth's surface is covered by water, most of which is found in oceans.
(3) Earth’s oceans contain most of the planet's water, covering 71% of its surface.
(4) Oceans cover 71% of the Earth's surface, and most of the planet’s water is in the oceans.
10: While many people believe that all plants need direct sunlight to grow, some species actually thrive in low-light conditions.
(1) Some plants grow well in the shade, contrary to the belief that all plants need sunlight to survive.
(2) While direct sunlight is important for most plants, some species are better suited for low-light environments.
(3) It is commonly believed that plants need sunlight, but certain species can grow even in dim lighting.
(4) Many plants require sunlight to thrive, but others can adapt to environments with little light.
11: The expansion of urban areas is causing a rise in pollution, with cities contributing significantly to the overall increase in greenhouse gas emissions globally.
(1) As cities continue to grow, they contribute heavily to pollution, leading to higher global greenhouse gas emissions.
(2) The rapid growth of urban centers is contributing to pollution levels and the increase in greenhouse gas emissions worldwide.
(3) Urban expansion is accelerating pollution and increasing global greenhouse gas emissions, as cities contribute to environmental damage.
(4) While urban areas expand, their contribution to pollution and global greenhouse gas emissions is increasing at an alarming rate.
12: Although renewable energy sources such as solar and wind power are increasingly cost-effective, many nations are still heavily reliant on fossil fuels due to their established infrastructure and lower initial costs.
(1) While renewable energy is becoming cheaper, many countries continue to rely on fossil fuels because of their established systems and low start-up costs.
(2) Despite the growing affordability of solar and wind power, fossil fuels are still favored by many nations because of their low cost and existing infrastructure.
(3) Renewable energy is increasingly cost-effective, but many nations remain dependent on fossil fuels due to the high cost of switching infrastructure.
(4) Even though renewable energy is more affordable, fossil fuels continue to dominate in many countries due to lower initial costs and established energy systems.
